_comment: ‚ö†Ô∏è  IMPORTANT: After modifying this file, you MUST sync to DynamoDB! POST http://localhost:3000/api/tools/sync-registry (or production URL). Without syncing, changes will NOT take effect. See chatbot-app/agentcore/src/builtin_tools/__init__.py for full instructions.

shared_guidance.citation_instructions:
Citation Instructions for Web Search Results:

When your response is based on content returned by web search tools (web_search, url_fetcher, google_search, arxiv, wikipedia, tavily), you MUST appropriately cite your response.

**Citation Rules:**
- EVERY specific claim from search results should be wrapped in <cite> tags: <cite source="SOURCE_TITLE" url="URL">claim text</cite>
- The source attribute should contain the title or name of the source
- The url attribute should contain the source URL when available
- Use citations for factual claims, statistics, quotes, and specific information from search results
- Do NOT cite your own reasoning or general knowledge
- If search results don't contain relevant information, inform the user that the answer cannot be found in the search results

**Example:**
<cite source="Wikipedia" url="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Example">The population of Tokyo is approximately 14 million.</cite>

**Important:**
- Only cite information actually present in the search results
- Use the minimum number of citations necessary to support claims
- For multiple sources supporting the same claim, include all relevant sources

local_tools.name: Visualization Creator
local_tools.description: Create interactive charts and visualizations from data
local_tools.systemPromptGuidance:
Visualization Best Practices:

**Data Format:**
- Bar/Line charts: [{"x": label, "y": value}]
- Pie charts: [{"segment": name, "value": number}]
- Optional colors: "color": "hsl(210, 100%, 50%)"

builtin_tools.name: Diagram Generator
builtin_tools.description: Generate diagrams and charts using Python code with Bedrock Code Interpreter
builtin_tools.systemPromptGuidance:
Diagram Generator Best Practices:

**Code Requirements:**
- Must include: plt.savefig(filename, dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight')
- Available libraries: matplotlib, pandas, numpy
- Recommended: plt.grid(True, alpha=0.3) for readability

builtin_tools.name: Word Documents
builtin_tools.description: Create, modify, and manage Word documents with automatic storage (4 tools)
builtin_tools.systemPromptGuidance:
Word Document Best Practices:

**Sequential Execution Required:** Run modification tools sequentially, never in parallel (prevents race conditions on S3 file read/write).

**When to Use:**
- create_word_document: User asks to create/generate a NEW Word document
- modify_word_document: User asks to edit/modify/update an EXISTING document or add content to existing document
- list_my_word_documents: User asks what documents are available
- read_word_document: User wants to download a document

**Filenames:** Letters, numbers, hyphens only (e.g., "sales-report.docx")

**Available Libraries:**
- python-docx (document creation)
- matplotlib, pandas, numpy (charts and data)
- Note: seaborn NOT available - use matplotlib instead

**Images:** If workspace has relevant images, include them: `run.add_picture('file.png', width=Inches(6))`

**Formatting:**
- ALWAYS preserve existing styles, fonts, colors
- NEVER use paragraph.text = 'new text' (destroys formatting)
- Use runs to modify text while preserving formatting

tools.name: Create Document
tools.description: Create new Word document from Markdown content

tools.name: Modify Document
tools.description: Edit existing Word document using python-docx code

tools.name: List Documents
tools.description: List all Word documents in workspace

tools.name: Read Document
tools.description: Read and download document from workspace

builtin_tools.name: Excel Spreadsheets
builtin_tools.description: Create, modify, and manage Excel spreadsheets with automatic storage (4 tools)
builtin_tools.systemPromptGuidance:
Excel Spreadsheet Best Practices:

**Sequential Execution Required:** Run modification tools sequentially, never in parallel (prevents race conditions on S3 file read/write).

**When to Use:**
- create_excel_spreadsheet: User asks to create/generate a NEW Excel spreadsheet
- modify_excel_spreadsheet: User asks to edit/modify/update an EXISTING spreadsheet or add sheets/data to existing spreadsheet
- list_my_excel_spreadsheets: User asks what spreadsheets are available
- read_excel_spreadsheet: User wants to download a spreadsheet

**Filenames:** Letters, numbers, hyphens only (e.g., "Q4-sales.xlsx")

**Available Libraries:**
- openpyxl (spreadsheet creation)
- matplotlib, pandas, numpy (charts and data)

**Images:** If workspace has relevant images: `from openpyxl.drawing.image import Image; ws.add_image(Image('file.png'), 'E1')`

**Data Structure:**
- Use tables for structured data (TableStyleInfo)
- Add charts for visualization (BarChart, LineChart, PieChart)
- Format cells appropriately (Font, PatternFill, Alignment)
- Use multiple sheets for organization

**Formulas:**
- Use Excel formulas instead of hardcoded values: '=SUM(B2:B10)', '=AVERAGE(C2:C50)'
- Avoid circular references (A1='=A1+1' or A1='=B1' and B1='=A1')

tools.name: Modify Spreadsheet
tools.description: Edit existing Excel spreadsheet using openpyxl code

tools.description: List all Excel spreadsheets in workspace

tools.description: Read and download spreadsheet from workspace

builtin_tools.name: PPT Presentations
builtin_tools.description: Create, modify, and manage PPT presentations with high-level operations (10 tools)
builtin_tools.systemPromptGuidance:
PowerPoint Best Practices:

**CRITICAL Rules:**
- Batch required: 1 call for all slides (parallel calls = data loss)
- Operations: update_text, update_image only
- update_text: replaces entire element (use \n for multi-line)
- Output name must differ from source

**Images:** If workspace has relevant images: `slide.shapes.add_picture('file.png', Inches(1), Inches(2), width=Inches(8))`

**Text Editing:**
- Preserve original text length when possible
- Long existing text often indicates design constraints
- Be concise - not all improvements need longer text
- Consider layout: expanding text can break visual design

**Position Info:**
- analyze shows element positions: (left", top", width"√óheight")
- Helps understand layout: titles ~top:0.3", bodies ~top:1.5"

**Speaker Notes:**
- analyze shows existing notes
- Use update_slide_notes when user wants to review/modify notes

**File Handling:**
- Existing/uploaded files: use modify tools only (create_presentation destroys layout)
- New files: create_presentation(name, outline, template_name)

**Rules:**
- Names: letters, numbers, hyphens only
- Indices: 0-based (slides & elements)

builtin_tools.name: Knowledge Base
builtin_tools.description: Create, manage, and query personal document catalogs with RAG capabilities (10 tools)
builtin_tools.systemPromptGuidance:
Knowledge Base Best Practices:

**Creating Catalogs:**
- Use descriptive names for organization (e.g., 'Project Research', 'Meeting Notes')
- Catalog names: letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens only

**Uploading Documents:**
- IMPORTANT: The upload_to_catalog tool retrieves file content from uploaded files automatically
- Only pass the filename parameter - do NOT pass file content as a parameter
- Supported formats: PDF, DOCX, TXT, MD, CSV (max 50MB)
- Each document gets indexed for RAG queries
- Indexing takes a few minutes after upload

**Querying Documents:**
1. Select a catalog with select_catalog
2. Ask natural language questions with query_catalog
3. Responses include source citations with relevance scores

**Workflow:**
- Use list_catalogs to see available catalogs
- Use get_indexing_status to check document processing
- Use list_catalog_documents to see contents

**Citations:**
- Query results include filename and relevance score
- Reference sources when providing answers

tools.description: Create a new document catalog for RAG queries

tools.name: List Catalogs
tools.description: List all knowledge base catalogs

tools.name: Upload Document
tools.description: Upload an attached document to a catalog for indexing. File content is retrieved automatically from uploaded files - only specify the filename.

tools.description: List all documents in a catalog

tools.name: Select Catalog
tools.description: Set the active catalog for RAG queries

tools.name: Query Catalog

tools.name: Check Indexing

tools.name: Delete Catalog

browser_automation.name: Nova Act Browser Control
browser_automation.description: Web browser automation powered by Nova Act AI (7 tools)
browser_automation.systemPromptGuidance:
Browser Automation Best Practices:

**When to Use Browser Tools:**
- Target a SPECIFIC website/URL
- Analyze web UI elements, layout, or interactive features
- Tasks requiring login, form submission, or multi-step navigation
- Extract data visible only after user interactions (clicks, scrolls, filters)

**Tool Selection:**
- navigate + act: UI interactions (click, type, scroll, form fill)
- extract: Structured data from visible content (auto-scrolls)
- get_page_info: Fast page structure check
- drag: For drawing, drag-and-drop, resizing, sliders. Requires coordinates - use get_page_info first to understand viewport size.
- save_screenshot: Capture visual evidence for documents or reports

**On Failure:** Simplify instruction, reduce schema complexity, or pivot to search APIs.

tools.name: Navigate
tools.description: Navigate browser to a URL and see the page

tools.name: Browser Action
tools.description: Execute browser actions using natural language (click, type, scroll, select). Does NOT support drag - use browser_drag instead.

tools.name: Extract Data
tools.description: Extract structured data (auto-scrolls entire page, collects all data in single call)

tools.name: Get Page Info
tools.description: Get page structure and all open tabs (fast, no AI)

tools.name: Manage Tabs
tools.description: Switch, close, or create browser tabs (use get_page_info to view tabs)

tools.name: Drag
tools.description: Drag from start to end coordinates (for drawing, resizing, moving elements)

tools.name: Save Screenshot
tools.description: Save current page screenshot to workspace for document use

tools.name: Browser Automation Skill
tools.description: Execute multi-step browser tasks: navigate websites, interact with elements, fill forms, extract information using AI-driven adaptive navigation

gateway_targets.name: Google Maps
gateway_targets.systemPromptGuidance:
Google Maps Best Practices:

**When to Use:**
- ALWAYS call show_on_map after collecting location data - visual maps are the primary value
- Use for: search results, directions, comparisons, or any location-based query

**Response Pattern (DO NOT call show_on_map in parallel):**
1. Text: Introduce what you'll show ("Here are the top restaurants:")
2. show_on_map: Display the map
3. Text: Explain the results ("These restaurants are rated 4.5+ stars")

Example:
- "Let me show you restaurants in Gangnam:" ‚Üí show_on_map(restaurants) ‚Üí "All 5 restaurants above have excellent reviews."
- For multiple categories: Text ‚Üí Map 1 ‚Üí Text ‚Üí Map 2 (sequential, not parallel)

**Map Organization:**
- Separate maps for different categories (restaurants vs hotels)
- Show 1-5 most relevant places per map

**Tool Selection:**
- search_places: text queries | search_nearby_places: coordinates
- Preserve place_id for details | Infer direction mode from context

tools.description: Search for places using text query (e.g., 'restaurants in New York')

tools.description: Search for places near a specific location

agentcore_runtime_a2a.name: Research Agent
agentcore_runtime_a2a.description: Web research and markdown report generation via A2A
agentcore_runtime_a2a.systemPromptGuidance:
Research Agent Best Practices:

**After completion:**
- Research report is shown directly to user in Research Modal
- Your response should only summarize key findings (2-3 sentences)
- Do NOT repeat the full report content
